languages.custom: the languages it knew in life

description.value:
Tloques-Popolocas makes two attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 2d4 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage. Instead of dealing damage, Tloques-Popolocas can grapple the target (escape DC 13).

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5ft, one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod + 2 type=slashing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 1d10 + @mod + 2 type=slashing average=true]] damage if used with two hands.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Tloques-Popolocas magically calls 2d4 swarm of bats;swarms of bats, provided that the sun isn't up. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of Tloques-Popolocas and obeying his spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until Tloques-Popolocas dies, or until Tloques-Popolocas dismisses them as a bonus action.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regeneration. Tloques-Popolocas regains [[/damage 10 type=heal average=false]] hit points at the start of his turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If Tloques-Popolocas takes &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of Tloques-Popolocas next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Spider Climb. Tloques-Popolocas can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Shapechanger. If Tloques-Popolocas isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat, or back into its true form.

While in bat form, Tloques-Popolocas can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and he has a flying speed of 30 feet. His statistics, other than his size and speed, are unchanged. Anything he's wearing transforms with it, but nothing he's carrying does. He reverts to its true form if he dies.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. He can innately cast the hold person spell at will, requiring no components, but his target must be able to see him.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Vampire Weaknesses. Tloques-Popolocas has the following flaws:

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Forbiddance. Tloques-Popolocas can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Harmed by Running Water. Tloques-Popolocas takes [[/damage 20 acid average=false]] damage when he ends his turn in running water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Stake to the Heart. Tloques-Popolocas is destroyed if a &Reference[piercing]{piercing} weapon made of wood is driven into his heart while it is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} in his resting place.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Sunlight Hypersensitivity. Tloques-Popolocas takes [[/damage 20 radiant average=false]] damage when he starts his turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, he has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
